channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2024021015
item.description:
Report X-2024021015

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package handler was unloading the package they noticed the side was wet and it sounded like broken glass coming from inside the box itsekt. DescribePack: broken body of the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was discovered the package was placed inside a hazmat tote, taken to the damaged hazmat cage, and set under the vent.

item.title: Report X-2024020771
item.description:
Report X-2024020771

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: EAST WENATCHEE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg loaded to delivery truck and out for dlvry. Driver noticed wet outer pack, coded 10 inspection required. Pkg sent to QA department. During inspection noted hazmat label and used proper protective equipment. Outer pack cardboard slightly dented on top, wet at bottom and small area on side. Inner product dented in on top of one side causing plastic to crack at seam of jug, both jugs dented in. One much worse with small 2 cm hole, leaking contents onto outer pack. Miss handling was not noted by staff, unsure what happened to cause dented top of product. DescribePack: Inner product dented in on top of one side causing plastic to crack at seam of jug along vertical edge, both jugs dented in. One much worse with small 2 cm hole, leaking contents onto outer pack. Miss handling was not noted by staff, unsure what happened to cause dented top of product. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Driver isolated product during transport. Station staff used PPE and contained package in Hazmat tote. moved to Hazmat area for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024020833
item.description:
Report X-2024020833

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was removed from the package flow due to leaking carton; package was then brought to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: Two bottles of Rapticide PA Part A have leaked its content through vented caps. Package also contains Rapicide Part B bottles which have been exposed / soiled by the leaking one. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a lined tote.
